title: Goldman’s Long-Term Shift Remains Key
sub_head: Gains on Wall Street trading desks may be slowing, but Goldman Sachs is still placing bets on a steadier future
body:
Wall Street trading may not be quite the bonanza it was in 2021, but investors don’t have to cash in their bets quite yet.
Shares of Goldman Sachs are tumbling sharply on Tuesday, down about 8%. Investors might be worried about trading desks, with the bank’s reported fourth-quarter trading net revenue down 7% versus the prior year. But it was hardly in free fall. Fixed income, currency and commodities trading revenue was down just 1% versus the fourth quarter 2020 at Goldman, smaller than declines at peers that have reported thus far.
